page.title: 13FARMING NOTES, LODSWORTH
page.content: {Mixed farms dominate our area , they {provide work, housing and recreation. { { Roger Comber}of{Manor Farm}writes a regular column in{ OUTLOOK }the parish magazine. We discovered that milk quotas were introduced on 1st April 1984, to reduce production throughout the Common Market just as the Spring drought reduced the silage, gathered in rain. The barley yield suffered in the summer drought but the harvest of grain and straw was bone dry. This year with the cold dry spring the first silage crop was less than last year. Rains in June promised a larger second cut, because the colder weather allowed the sward to grow. The wet August reduced yields of wheat, barley and straw. Late harvesting meant late sowing for winter grain; lighter crops next year.
